original_title: Japan Finance Minister discusses resumption of stalled projects
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Japan’s Finance Minister, Suzuki Shunichi has discussed the resumption of stalled Japanese projects, especially projects such as the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) redevelopment, in a meeting with President Ranil Wickremesinghe.

“I realize that there has been a significant improvement in your economic situation,” Suzuki, who is on a two-day official visit (11-12), was quoted as saying in a statement by the president’s media division.

The discussion encompassed future collaborations in information-technological cooperation and maritime-security collaboration, the resumption of stalled projects, long-term bilateral cooperation, finalization of debt restructuring agreements and pipeline projects.
The discussions aimed to fortify ties and lay the groundwork for a more robust and cooperative economic relationship between Japan and Sri Lanka, according to the statement.
Shunichi acknowledged the completion of the first review under the IMF program and highlighted the international community’s recognition of the challenging reforms undertaken by Sri Lanka.
“I think there are very encouraging signs that the program is beginning to work, that the economy is stabilizing.” (Colombo/Jan12/20024)
